description: 19th century, from Latin apiānus, from apis (“bee”).

adjectives.description: apian (comparative more apian, superlative most apian)

examples: In fact, apian, formican, vespal, and termital government is not a monarchy, but a pure democracy. The queens of ants, bees, wasps, and termites wear the crown of maternity — no other.
The largest of all the apians is the humble-bee, or humming-bee (Bombus).
